Pagination

Pagination is used when a data set is split across several pages and requires controls for navigating to the previous and next pages.

Example

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

1 - 10 of 27 Results

  • ${require('@deere/ux.brand-foundations/icons/chevron_left.svg')}
  • Page 1 of 33
  • Previous
  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • Next
  • ${require('@deere/ux.brand-foundations/icons/chevron_right.svg')}

31 - 40 of 438 Results

  • ${require('@deere/ux.brand-foundations/icons/chevron_left.svg')}
  • Page 4 of 33
  • Previous
  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • 438
  • Next
  • ${require('@deere/ux.brand-foundations/icons/chevron_right.svg')}

431 - 438 of 438 Results

  • ${require('@deere/ux.brand-foundations/icons/chevron_left.svg')}
  • Page 33 of 33
  • Previous
  • 1
  • 435
  • 436
  • 437
  • 438
  • 438
  • Next
  • ${require('@deere/ux.brand-foundations/icons/chevron_right.svg')}

Guidelines

  • In general, pagination should be used when more than 25 items need to be displayed in a single view. Actual number of items displayed may vary depending on context, or if using a Datatable.
  • Page links should allow enough space between one another to avoid overlap of clickable areas.
  • Within the set of pagination links, the Next button should be the primary call to action. This guideline is based on studies that show users prefer using Previous and Next buttons, and will rarely skip to specific pages in the middle of a data set.
  • Do not show more than 5 page items in the pagination to avoid having the pagination extend its container.
  • For projects that donâ€™t utilize UXFrame, every effort should be made to match the look and feel of the standard pagination component.

Documentation

Bootstrap Documentation

Modifiers

Class Description
.pagination-lg add class to ul.pagination element to make the pagination elements larger. Avoid using on mobile.
.pagination-sm add class to ul.pagination element to make the pagination elements smaller
.uxf-pagination-has-first add class to ul.pagination element to include '1...' at the beginning of the pagination
.uxf-pagination-has-last add class to ul.pagination element to include '...#' at the end of the pagination
.uxf-pagination-mobile-page add class to second li element to include correct styling for mobile pagination
.uxf-pagination-mobile-first add class to ul.pagination element to remove mobile previous icon
.uxf-pagination-mobile-last add class to ul.pagination element to remove mobile next icon

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2

  1. Remove .clear-panel
  2. Move .prev to the ul element; Change to .pagination-has-prev
  3. Move .first to the ul element; Change to .pagination-has-first
  4. Move .next to the ul element; Change to .pagination-has-next
  5. Change div .pagination.traditional to div .panel-body
  6. Change li .selected to li .active
  7. Add .pagination.clear-bottom-margin.clear-top-margin.pull-right to the ul element
